executive_summary: Operators in the Boat Rental industry offer various boats and watercraft for rental. Boats are generally more expensive to rent than other entertainment alternatives, therefore, demand is dependent on high levels of disposable income and consumer confidence. Industry revenue increased each year during the current period, except in 2020, as the industry struggled amid the pandemic because of travel restrictions and temporary lockdown measures. Altogether, over the past five years, revenue has grown at a CAGR of 1.9% to $5.3 billion, including an expected 0.7% increase in 2024. Profit is expected to climb to 7.3% of revenue in 2024 from 7.1% in 2019.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Covid-19 Pandemic Sinks Revenue in 2020
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The pandemic created the ideal environment of free time, disposable income and demand for outdoor activities for the boat rental industry. However, consumer confidence and domestic trips by US residents plummeted in 2020. When domestic trips by US residents decline, it typically results in reduced boat rental activity, as boats are often rented on vacation. Industry demand was significantly reduced in 2020 due to pandemic lockdown measures and travel restrictions. In addition, total recreation expenditure, which tracks the total amount spent by US consumers on recreation services per year, shrunk, contributing to industry revenue declines.
Demand for boat rentals climbed following the easing of lockdown measures imposed during the pandemic as heightened interest in safe, outdoor activities, such as boating, jumped.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Operators Encounter Rising Competition From The Development Of Peer-To-Peer Rental Services And Larger Operators
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Although the industry has benefited from rising disposable income, it has also experienced heightened competition due to the development of peer-to-peer rental services and the entrance of larger operators to the industry. Similar to the home rental operator Airbnb Inc., customers can rent boats directly from owners or operators on water-based sharing apps. Customers can search where and when they want to rent the boat, a preferred hourly price, the number of passengers and the type of boating they are seeking. The increasing popularity of these applications has raised competition in the industry, while simultaneously lowering the barriers to rent a boat for consumers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Sustaining Growth Following Disruptions Caused By The Pandemic
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The pandemic resulted in disruptions and temporary lockdown measures, hindering industry revenue in 2020. However, the Boat Rentals industry experienced solid growth for most of the current period, in line with rising disposable income and leisure time spent. Ultimately, industry revenue grew substantially in 2021. Increased per capita disposable income levels enabled individuals to rent boats with increased frequency. Furthermore, pent-up demand for tourism following the pandemic has benefitted operators, as tourists are likely to rent boats for daily excursions or the duration of their vacation. The myriad of options operators provide, as well as the number of activities in which boating enables an individual to participate in, including wakeboarding and fishing, has helped the industry entice consumers from diverse backgrounds.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Sharing Economy is Expected to Expand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The popularity of the boat-sharing economy is anticipated to rise over the next five years. As more services are conducted online and time spent online by consumers is anticipated to rise, operators will likely need to maintain an online presence to entice customers and draw from a larger potential market. In addition, sharing platforms are anticipated to reach boats in additional bodies of water in the United States. For example, GetMyBoat, which is the world's largest boat rental and water experience marketplace, has grown from primarily operating in top US boating cities such as Miami, to having boats available in 9,300 destinations across 184 countries. The rising popularity of boat rentals is likely to entice larger operators to enter the industry, raising competition.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry offer piloted and unpiloted boats and other watercraft for rental.

opportunities: High Performance Drivers - Per capita disposable income
threats: Time spent on leisure and sports

key_trends: The pandemic negatively impacted industry revenue in 2020.
Consumer confidence and domestic trips by US residents plummeted, reducing boat rental activity.
The sharing economy is here to stay - The popularity of the boat-sharing economy is expected to expand as more services are conducted online.

Regulations focus on safety and environmental sustainability - Regulatory policies ensure the safety of products and environmental friendliness. Operators must adhere to state and local regulations. Boat rental operators must obtain the necessary licensing requirements.
Motorboat rentals comprise the largest product segment - Motorboats can accommodate larger groups of people and more water activities.
The market for individuals aged 65 and older has lagged - Consumers in this market are more likely to own a boat, limiting this market's share of industry revenue.

Operators compete on a local level - Most boat operators are regionally or locally based and, therefore, try to differentiate themselves to better compete against competitors in the region in which they operate.
Operators face high internal competition, particularly in regions with nearby boating hubs - Competition can depend on the boating activities offered in a particular area.
The increasing popularity of water-based sharing apps has increased competition in the industry - At the same time, this has lowered barriers to rent a boat.

market_segmentation.segment: Individuals aged between 18 and 44 years old
market_segmentation.segment_description: Individuals aged between 18 and 44 years old comprise the largest market and are expected to account for roughly one-third of industry revenue. Individuals in this market typically have less disposable income than older individuals however, individuals in this market seek to travel for new experiences and adventure. An increase in the number of domestic trips in the US generally leads to increased demand for boat rentals, as boats are typically rented while on vacation.

Individuals aged between 45 and 64 are expected to account for roughly one-third of industry revenue. This market has benefitted from growing disposable income and the climb in households earning more than $100,000. Boats are typically expensive to rent, therefore, when disposable income climbs, the industry typically encounters increased demand from this market.

Individuals aged 65 and older account for less than one-quarter of industry revenue. Individuals in this market typically have the most disposable income and leisure time after retirement. Therefore, consumers in this market are in the strongest financial position to afford boat rentals. However, this market is limited because individuals aged 65 and older are more likely to enter the prime age group for boat buying, hindering this industry.

products_and_services.product_description: Motorboat rentals comprise the largest product segment and are expected to account for roughly one-half of industry revenue. Motorboats come in various sizes and can accommodate larger groups of people and various water activities. Motorboats can be used on different bodies of water such as lakes and coastal waters. Individuals can easily partake in fishing activities and cruising on motorboats, contributing to its popularity. In addition, motorboats are generally more expensive to rent than personal watercraft. This contributes to growth in this product segment.

Personal watercraft rentals comprise the second-largest product segment and are expected to account for over one-quarter of industry revenue. Consumers are limited in activities on personal watercraft. Personal watercraft such as jet skis are popular among younger individuals because they are easy to operate and provide a thrill to riders as they can reach high speeds. In addition, personal watercraft rentals are typically more affordable than motorboat rentals, making them a popular choice for consumers with limited disposable income.
Yacht and sailboat rental comprise the smallest product segment in the industry. Yachts and sailboat rentals are typically expensive to rent and offer a more luxurious experience for consumers.

tier_2_suppliers: Boat Dealership and Repair in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: As consumers have more money to spend on industry products, this will increase demand and represent a potential opportunity for the industry.

basis_points.basis_description: Operators compete on a local level. Most boat operators are regionally or locally based and, therefore, try to differentiate themselves to better compete against competitors in the region in which they operate.
Operators face high internal competition, particularly in regions with nearby boating hubs. Competition can depend on the boating activities offered in a particular area.

The increasing popularity of water-based sharing apps has increased competition in the industry. At the same time, this has lowered barriers to rent boats, allowing more operators to enter the market.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Motorboat rentals comprise the largest product segment and are expected to account for roughly one-half of industry revenue.
Personal watercraft rentals comprise the second-largest product segment and are expected to account for over one-quarter of industry revenue.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Yacht and sailboat rentals smallest segment
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Yacht and sailboat rental comprise the smallest product segment in the industry.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Low rate of new patent technologies
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The rate of new patent technologies entering the industry is low, which limits the potential for innovations.
The concentration of technologies is high in this industry. This suggests that industry operators have exposure to potentially unforeseen areas of innovation.

The major markets for this industry are highly concentrated, which implies that the market has a focus on key customer segments. This presents an opportunity for strategic entrance into lower-end markets or unserved markets for innovations to take on a disruptive trajectory.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Industry revenue is driven by consumer confidence. Falling consumer confidence reduces travel and discretionary spending, hindering demand for the industry, specifically during the pandemic.
Industry revenue slumped in 2020 because of coronavirus-related social distancing regulations.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Boosted by disposable income and leisure time
volatility_points.volatility_description: Rising levels of disposable income and leisure time spent over the past five years boosted industry revenue following the easing of restrictions put in place amid the pandemic.

FAQs.question: What kind of customer relation services do you currently provide?
FAQs.answer: Maintaining strong customer relationships will likely result in repeat rentals.

FAQs.question: Have you had to adjust customer relations in the past to maintain excellence?
What steps have you taken to ensure your pricing is appropriate?
FAQs.answer: The industry competes based on price. To this end, companies must ensure an appropriate pricing policy to maintain their competitiveness in the industry.

FAQs.question: Are you able to competitively price your products and services?
What kind of new technology have you recently implemented?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators that adopt new technology, such as boat rental apps, are likely to benefit from an increased consumer base.

FAQs.question: How have you quickly adjusted to new technology in the past?
Are you able to change your offerings and prices according to the economy?
How does the decreasing leisure time affect your business?
FAQs.answer: The more leisure time people have, the more likely they are to spend time boating. Therefore, as people have more time and resources, demand for industry services grows.

FAQs.question: Has your company experienced demand disruption from domestic travel restrictions amid the coronavirus pandemic?
FAQs.answer: When the number of domestic trips rises, demand for industry services grows.

FAQs.question: How have you adapted your business model?
Do you monitor changes in the value of private nonresidential construction?
How do you take advantage when the value increases?
FAQs.answer: When per capita disposable income rises, consumers have more money to spend on industry products.
